column4: puff heh only if bios is locked so they can't boot from anything else ;/'

What I mean though, is, leave me in the room with your ubuntu laptop for five minutes and I can boot into single user mode and reset root.   Change the grub setting, now I need a bootable media that your machine will boot.
Security is a scalar, not a boolan.  It's  all about how high you raise the bar.
